title: Jared Littman wins primary election for mayor of Annapolis
summary: Jared Littmann won the Annapolis mayoral primary with 67% of the vote and will face Republican Bob O’Shea in the general election. Several aldermanic candidates also secured primary wins, with general elections for mayor and all eight aldermanic seats set for Nov.

title: Trump administration warns Maryland against “DEI” contracts in Key Bridge rebuild
summary: The Trump administration warned Maryland against using race and gender-based criteria in awarding contracts for the Key Bridge reconstruction, citing legal and efficiency concerns. Maryland officials emphasized the project's congressional approval and legal contract process, while the administration questioned its budget and diversity-focused hiring practices.

title: Maryland Democratic lawmakers see Kimmel suspension as threat to free speech
summary: Maryland Democratic lawmakers condemned ABC's suspension of *Jimmy Kimmel Live!* following controversial remarks about the assassination of conservative commentator Charlie Kirk, calling it a threat to free speech and a form of censorship akin to authoritarian practices. They introduced the No Political Enemies Act to protect free expression and criticized the decision as part of a broader effort to silence critics, particularly under former President Donald Trump's administration.

title: CNS News Quiz | Week of Sept. 15: Gov. Moore’s priorities, funding for cancer research and more
summary: The article promotes a weekly news quiz covering topics such as Governor Moore's priorities and funding for cancer research. It encourages readers to follow Capital News Service across various platforms to stay informed.

title: DC Council approves Commanders move from Maryland back to Washington
summary: The DC Council approved the construction of a new stadium in Washington, D.C., to bring the Washington Commanders back from Maryland, with the project expected to be completed by 2030. The development includes a transparent-roof stadium and a larger mixed-use area, funded largely by the team, marking a major revitalization effort for the Anacostia Waterfront.
